page.title: 08SCHOOLS
page.content: There are two Primary Schools, one in Butleigh, one in Baltonsborough. Butleigh School was built in 1845 as a National School. Today there are 85 pupils in the age range 5_11 and it is mixed. The pupils come from mainly Butleigh but also Butleigh Wooten, Street, Barton St.David, Keinton Mandeville, Baltonsborough, Wedmore (10 miles away) and Glastonbury. There are four teachers, one is part time. Baltonsborough School was started in 1850 to cater for 100-125 children. There are 78 there now mostly from Baltonsborough, West Pennard, Keinton Mandeville and Barton St.David. There are three teachers and one part timer. Both schools get their school lunches from Glastonbury in hot-locks, as neither have their own kitchens.
